robert laing wrote:
> until yesterday, i had a running heritrix process on a server,
> working good
> 
> now crawls doesn't starts, i'm not able to debugging causes.
> 
> sure that nothing was changed, either networking or java environment,
> i tried dumping tcp (tcpdump, ngrep), but in cannot see any
> network activity from heritrix 
> 
> on web console, i can see that it stops at ABOUT_TO_GET_URI
> 
> Frontier
> 1 URI queues: 1 active (0 in-process; 0 ready; 1 snoozed); 0 inactive; 0 ineligible; 0 retired; 0 exhausted [RUN: 0 in, 0 out]
> Threads
> 25 threads: 25 ABOUT_TO_GET_URI; 25
> 
> any hints to further debugging?
> thank you

Looks like only a single queue has eligible URIs to crawl. If that host 
is not responding, Heritrix (by default) goes into a slow-retry mode, 
retrying every 15 minutes. This will often look like no activity at all.

See if the Web UI frontier report shows a multi-minute snooze time on 
that queue. Try the queue's top URI in a web browser. It may be 
nothing's wrong, there's just nothing gettable.

- Gordon @ IA
